title: MySQL Import & Export
subject: MySQL
theory:
## Moving Data
Sometimes you need to import/export data from CSV or text files directly, without full backups.

### Import: LOAD DATA INFILE
Very fast way to read a text file into a table.
`LOAD DATA INFILE 'data.csv' INTO TABLE t...`

### Export: INTO OUTFILE
Writes query results to a file on the server.
`SELECT * FROM t INTO OUTFILE 'data.csv' ...`
syntax:
LOAD DATA INFILE 'path/file.csv'
INTO TABLE table_name
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ','
LINES TERMINATED BY '
';

examples.code:
SELECT * FROM students
INTO OUTFILE '/var/lib/mysql-files/students.csv'
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' ENCLOSED BY '"'
LINES TERMINATED BY '
';

common_mistakes.correction: MySQL server runs as a specific user. It can only read/write files in directories getting specific permissions (like `secure_file_priv` directory).

real_world_use_cases.description: Save Excel as CSV. Use LOAD DATA INFILE to import thousands of rows in seconds.

exam_notes: LOAD DATA INFILE is extremely fast.
summary: Import/Export features are vital for data integration, warehousing, and Excel interaction.
